channel.title: Testing on MeVisLab Examples
channel.description: Recent content in Testing on MeVisLab Examples

item.title: Chapter VI: Testing
item.description:
MeVisLab Tutorial Chapter VI

Testing, Profiling, and Debugging in MeVisLab

The MeVisLab Integrated Development Environment (IDE) provides tools to write automated tests in Python, to profile your network performance, and to debug your Python code. All of these funtionalities will be addressed in this chapter.

Testing

The MeVisLab TestCenter is the starting point of your tests. Select [ File → Run TestCaseManager ] to open the user interface of the TestCaseManager.

item.title: Example 1: Writing a Simple Test Case in MeVisLab
item.description:
Example 1: Writing a Simple Test Case in MeVisLab

     This example is also available on YouTube.

Introduction

In this example you will learn how to write an automated test for a simple network using the DicomImport, MinMaxScan, and View3D modules. Afterward, you will be able to write test cases for any other module and network yourself.

Steps to Do

item.title: Example 3: Iterative Tests in MeVisLab With Screenshots
item.description:
Example 3: Iterative Tests in MeVisLab

     This example is also available on YouTube.

Introduction

In this example you are writing an iterative test. Iterative test functions run a function for every specified input. They return a tuple consisting of the function object called and the inputs iterated over. The iterative test functions are useful if the same function should be applied to different input data. These could be input values, names of input images, etc.
